result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian P. Johnson

defendant.name: Johnson, Brian P.
defendant.address: 1330 St James Ct Apt 114, Wauwatosa, WI 53213

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 10, 2019 at 02:00 pm.

10:28 AM Defendant Brian P. Johnson in court with attorney Mark J Gumz.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM118 and 16CM24 tracking together:
  Atty Juech states plea agreement to Ct. 2 in 15CM118.  Ct. 1 and 16CM24 to be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendant agrees.  
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 2 in 15CM118.  
Ct. 1 and 16CM24 to be dismissed and read-in.

Atty Juech makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments and asks for probation.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.  

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 2 in 15CM118:  Impose and stay; 180 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber:
1 year Probation with conditions:
Maintain Absolute Sobriety
Court Costs = $243.00
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00

Ct. 1 and 16CM24 to be dismissed and read-in.
Status conference on October 29, 2019 at 09:30 am.

02:59 PM Attorney Mark J Gumz in court.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM118 and 16CM24 tracking:
NOT ON THE RECORD:
Atty Gumz asks for a status  Status conference scheduled for October 29, 2019 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Return date on August 27, 2019 at 10:00 am.
Defendant appeared in court; warrant satisfied.

03:23 PM Defendant Brian P. Johnson appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Brian J. Juech appeared for State of Wisconsin.
16CM24 and 15CM118 tracking together:
BY THE COURT:  Warrants satisfied in both cases.

Court questions the defendant as to why he failed to appear a the January 2016 hearing.  Defendant responds.  

Atty Juech does not object to a signature bond with conditions.

  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions on each case.  Return date scheduled for August 27, 2019 at 10:00 am.
